[[Member of the Order of Australia]] |relations= |laterwork= }} [[Major General (Australia)|Major General]] '''John Graham Caligari''' [[Distinguished Service Cross (Australia)|DSC]] [[Member of the Order of Australia|AM]], is a senior officer of the [[Australian Army]]. His current appointment is Head Modernisation and Strategic Plans â Army (HMSP-A). ==Early life== Caligari was born in [[Brisbane]] in 1960. He graduated from [[Marist College Canberra]] in 1978, and entered the [[Royal Military College, Duntroon]] the following year where he undertook training to become an [[Officer (armed forces)|officer]] in the Australian Army.Banham, Cynthia, [http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/model-of-a-modern-digger/2008/03/14/1205472088607.html?page=fullpage#contentSwap2 Model of a modern digger], 15 March 2008, Sydney Morning Herald[http://www.eurekacouncil.com.au/Australian-Defence/Data-Sheets/brigadier_john_caligari.htm Biography], 6 August 2009, www.eurekacouncil.com.au ==Military career== Upon graduating from Duntroon in 1982, Caligari was assigned to the [[Royal Australian Infantry Corps]] and was posted to the [[1st Battalion, Royal Australian Regiment]] (1 RAR), an infantry unit that his father, Barry Caligari, commanded. In 1989, Caligari was in the Middle East as a United Nations observer on the Lebanese/Israeli border with [[UNTSO]], and subsequently at at UNTSO Headquarters in Jerusalem ([[Operation Paladin]]). He took his wife, Narelle, a nurse, and his twin sons, then aged nine months, with him to Israel. From late 1990, he was a rifle company commander in the [[1st Battalion, Royal Australian Regiment|1st Battalion]]. In 1993 he was an operations officer of the 1st Battalion Group deployed to Somalia as part of [[Operation Solace]], for which he was awarded a [[Chief of the Defence Force (Australia)|Chief of the Defence Force]] Commendation. In June 2000, he deployed as Commander of the 1st Battalion Ready Group on [[HMAS Manoora (L 52)|HMAS ''Manoora'']] for the evacuation of Australians from the [[Solomon Islands]] ([[Operation Plumbob]]). His next deployment was to East Timor after it achieved independence in 1999. "The highlight of his career" was commanding the 1st Battalion Group on operations along the [[Timor Leste]]-Indonesian border with the [[UNTAET|United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor]] (UNTAET), as part of [[Operation Tanager]]. For his command and leadership on this operation he was awarded the [[Distinguished Service Cross (Australia)|Distinguished Service Cross]]. Caligari oversaw numerous reforms while Chief of Staff, Headquarters Training Command â Army in 2005â06, under Major General [[Richard Wilson (general)|Richard Wilson]]. In 2007â08 Caligari commanded of the Townsville-based [[3rd Brigade (Australia)|3rd Brigade]], as a [[brigadier]].Johnston, Jessica, [http://www.townsvillebulletin.com.au/article/2008/11/22/23871_newsphoto.html Salute to a military man â 3rd Brigade boss Brigadier John Caligari says goodbye to Townsville], 22 November 2008, Townsville Bulletin In January 2009 he was appointed Deputy Commander Joint Task Force 633 â Afghanistan as part of [[Operation Slipper]], a position he filled for six months. Promoted to [[major general]] in mid-2009, his current appointment is as Head Modernisation and Strategic Plans â Army (HMSP-A). ==Personal life== His father, Barry,[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=906397&search_type=quick&showInd=true National Medal], CALIGARI, Barry John, 14 July 1977, www.itsanhonour.gov.au[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=906399&search_type=quick&showInd=true National Medal â 1st Clasp], CALIGARI, Barry John, 3 September 1985, www.itsanhonour.gov.au retired as Commanding Officer of the 1st Battalion in 1983. Caligari and his father hold the distinction of being the only father-son duo in the Australian Army to have commanded the same battalion. Caligari's father was his son's commanding officer for two months when he graduated from Duntroon in 1982. He married a nurse, Narelle, circa 1987 and they have three children; twin sons and a girl. Caligari's twin sons Ben and David, aged 19, were inducted into the [[Australian Defence Force Academy]] in 2008. His daughter, Anne, is currently studying Bachelor of Laws and Bachelor of Commerce at the University of Canberra.{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} ==Educational and professional qualifications==
